description: From Middle English methafisicien, from methafisik on the model of fisicien or perhaps from rare and late Old French methafisicien.

entries.meaning: (philosophy) A philosopher who specializes in the scholarly study of metaphysics.
examples: Thomas Aquinas was a notable metaphysician.
Professor Jones is an eminent metaphysician; she has produced more than one hundred refereed publications concerning metaphysics.
